support.description: Content is actively maintained. Please report errors and inconsistencies

author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo, yānimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—
segments.en: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why these various misconceptions arise in the world? That is:

segments.pli: sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā … pe …
segments.en: the cosmos is eternal, or not eternal …

segments.pli: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vā”ti?
segments.en: after death, a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist.”

segments.pli: “Vedanāya kho, vaccha, aññāṇā, vedanāsamudaye aññāṇā, vedanānirodhe aññāṇā, vedanānirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇā;
segments.en: “Vaccha, it is because of not knowing feeling, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation
that these various misconceptions arise in the world.

segments.pli: sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā … pe …
neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vāti.
Ayaṃ kho, vaccha, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo, yānimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—
segments.en: This is the cause, this is the reason.”

segments.pli: sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā … pe …
neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vā”ti.

suttaplex.blurb: The wanderer Vacchagotta asks the Buddha why the various speculative views come to be. The Buddha replies that it is because of not knowing feeling.
